UPDATED:
Easily our favorite neighborhood restaurant for breakfast. Their food is consistently tasty, fresh and made to order. Staff is friendly and kind; restaurant is clean and well kept. Love it here! Highly recommend!

ORIGINAL:
It was our first time here and the service was EXCELLENT, the restaurant was clean and nicely laid out.

The waitress was pleasant and patient. She explained the cuisine and menu items, and made recommendations. She also gave us free bu√±uelos to try - such a wonderful and tasty surprise. The pan de bono sandwich was extremely delicious, as was the chicken empanada. Their sauces (whatever they are) were also tasty!

I didn't enjoy the latte as much. I barely tasted the espresso. Perhaps the machine needs to be adjusted to add more espresso; or perhaps I need to add an extra espresso shot in mine. Next time, I'll try a different coffee drink to compare. I have faith it can be better.

We're looking forward to trying them again!
Excelente panader√≠a, buena calidad

I ordered a ice coffee with a pan de bono. Everything was so good, and packaged perfectly for a pick up! They gave me a two free cookies, an oatmeal raisin one and another that tasted a lot like an espresso shot, I loved it so much. I will be treating their other pastries ‚ò∫Ô∏è!
Siempre un placer venir aqui y en buena compa√±√≠a todo sabe mas rico
No muchas opciones diferentes. Pero el servicio es amable.

We loved Nana‚Äôs. We came very hungry and the Casuela Nana con frijoles. Pandebono sandwich had the perfect combination of crispy bacon, tangy sauce, and cheesy eggs. This place is perfect for any time of day. The staff is warm and friendly and extremely hospitable. We thoroughly enjoyed it. And left with smiles and full stomaches!

Love this caf√©! The bread and coffee are absolutely delicious, and the service is always great. The only downside‚Äîand I really hope they reconsider‚Äîis the scent diffuser. The fragrance smells like a hotel lobby, and it honestly makes me feel nauseous. I can never stay inside for long. In a caf√©, I want to smell fresh coffee and baked goods, not Santal 33 (or whatever it is). It just doesn‚Äôt pair well with food.

Puedo comenzar diciendo que me senti en una boutique. Una musica chill out de ambiente agradable. El aroma que predomina en el lugar huele delicioso, la atencion de las chicas ejemplar y la comida para pedir pan y remojar el plato, deliciosa. Cafeteria colombiana de primera!!

The ladies behind the register took their sweet time addressing the costumers behind the counter meanwhile... the shop was empty.

I love colombian bakeries, but nothing I ordered tasted authentic. I ordered two chicken emanadas, the dough was different, and the flavor of the chicken wasnt what I expected.
I also ordered an orejita that was greasy and not sweet at all. Won't be going back

I order Ajiaco it look and it was just warm. I gave it a chance soup was missing arrancacha and potatoes ,  and taste it like mazorca . Not good at all . Rice was stiff . My friend caldo para levantar muertos same a lot of water poor in substance . Empanadas were ok so was the pan de bono , coffee ok.
Need to check your soups no taste at all missing ingredients .

What a great little Colombian Cafe. Our first time visiting New York and Nana's Kitchen was only a block from the airbnb. It had such a variety of pastries and a full menu of some Colombian dishes! We went for breakfast and it was absolutely amazing. Definitely recommend!

Fabulous Colombian eatery.

Absolutely fantastic food. Ambiance is above standard for the neighborhood. Topping it with genuinely attentive service makes this eatery an amazing addition in the hood

It's a great coffee and breakfast spot!! They have lots of Colombian bakes. My favorite is always Pandebono, which is cheesy, a little sweet roll, I love it with coffee. I had also they healthy breakfast sandwich Bella, which is grilled portobello mushrooms, avocado, lettuce mix, walnuts, carrots, onions, and parmesan cheese and I also added sunny side up egg. It was really good. I'm definitely recommending this spot. üëå

S√∫per agradable lugar la comida  Super rica. Buena comida colombiana con gran sabor frescura acorde al precio del men√∫ excelente s√∫per recomendado de 10 /10. La torre recomendados el calentado nanas la sopa Levantamuertos Super Amazing

Lunch with the girls from work. It was my first time trying this restaurant & it did not disappoint. I tried the entra√±a & it was cooked exactly as I like. The portions are good. Also they make their own hot sauce & it‚Äôs really good. Will definitely be returning. They also have coffee, breakfast & dinner. If you‚Äôve been thinking about it don‚Äôt think so much and gooooo.

Update: Returned had a latte and a croissant. Best part they had non-dairy milk which for me is a huge plus.

Nana‚Äôs was a mixed bag. The breakfast sandwich was excellent, but on the other hand, their lattes were not great, due to being from a machine.

The pastries were okay. Some more flavorful than others. All of them were difficult to eat though (being extremely crumbly and such).

Also, it was unclear when we were going to be asked to pay. We were rung up at a register, but then not asked to pay for quite awhile. It wasn‚Äôt until everything was bagged up that we were rung up AGAIN on a different register to pay. Kind of confusing.

Oh, and they had Nat Geo playing lions ripping animals apart on their TVs behind the counter for some reason haha.

Service needs lots of improvement, I guess they know it's not good, that they have to lie about the number of guests to receive a tip.

First off all tip supposed to be a suggestion (don't take me wrong, I always leave tip no matter how bad the service is) I went with my husband and 2 kids so we were 4 people but the lie and put 6 to add the tip (so just be  AWARE you may be leaving Doble tip without knowing )

When our food arrived  we were missing a side  dish for one of the kids and the utensils at this point we didn't have any, so we wait a lot, so by the time the utensils and side dish arrived our food was cold already and from that point we never see the waitress again until we ask for the bill (but they seem more chatty with other tables) my kid wanted  a orange juice but whenever I looked for a server there was no one.
The food looks pretty but my husband was concerned about the meat (it was supposed to be beef but it looked and tasted like pork)  levanta muertos dish is what he ordered, it taste very bland the soup nothing special neither good.  I ask for Chicharron and I know they come with plantains but I didn't expect only 4 little pieces in each cup made of plantains I couldn't feel the chicharron at all only, the aftertaste of the chicharron was the sauce what was marinated very strong that overpowered the chicharron and bc it has some guacamole the chicharron felt soggy!.. so not coming back again

**Nana's Kitchen: A Colombian Culinary Gem**

Stepping into Nana's Kitchen is like being warmly embraced by the vibrant soul of Colombia. This hidden gem, tucked away in queen's, offers an authentic and delightful culinary journey that transports your taste buds straight to the streets of Medellin.

From the moment you enter, the welcoming atmosphere envelops you. The decor, a tasteful blend of traditional Colombian elements and modern touches, sets the stage for a memorable eating experience. But it's the food that truly steals the show.

The menu at Nana's Kitchen is a celebration of Colombia's rich culinary heritage. Each dish is crafted with love, using fresh ingredients and time-honored recipes.

For the main course, the bandeja paisa is an absolute must-try. This hearty platter, featuring a generous portion of beans, rice, chorizo, chicharr√≥n, plantains, and a fried egg, is a true feast for the senses. Every bite is a harmonious blend of textures and flavors, showcasing the richness of Colombian cuisine.

No meal at Nana's Kitchen would be complete without indulging in their desserts. The tres leches cake, moist and creamy, is a delightful end to a perfect meal. Pair it with a cup of Colombian coffee, rich and aromatic, and you'll be in dessert heaven.

What truly sets Nana's Kitchen apart is its dedication to authenticity and hospitality. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, always eager to share the stories behind each dish. Their passion for Colombian cuisine is evident in every aspect of the dining experience.

In conclusion, Nana's Kitchen is a culinary treasure that brings the heart and soul of Colombia to your table. Whether you're a connoisseur of Colombian food or a curious newcomer, this restaurant promises an unforgettable dining experience that will leave you enchanted and eager to return.

Dang! This little Colombian place on the corner 90th St and 31st Ave in Jackson Heights, NYC, is wonderful! Different, new, delicious, flavorful, authentic. The perfect end to a day of visiting customers. Warm, clean, well lit, friendly, modern atmosphere and service. The Ajiaco Nana‚Äôs is a winner! Shredded chicken soup with corn, potatoes and tasty ingredients that I can't name but can fully enjoy. On the side are rice, avocado, and banana to add, or not, as you decide. Sorry about the pic. I already dug in!
Oh, and their bathrooms were spotless. That's important to me.

This place was AMAZING! My boyfriend and I were staying in this area for a night, and looking for a nice spot for breakfast and came across this one. The staff were so nice, and the food was incredible. Would definitely come back again üôå
One of the most perfect places I have ever gone to  in NYC, the food was amazing, delicious, clean place, the bread is the best, 100% recommended
Un excelente lugar para disfruta con amigos, familia o hasta sola. Un caf√© o almuerzo todo rico, le presentaci√≥n, el lugar, las chicas que atienden super todo. 10/10
Sweet cafe with really nice food. Wish I could come back to try more of the food because they had a massive range.  Iced coffee was nice too.
Simplemente delicioso! Las chicas son s√∫per atentas y dispuestas siempre a ofrecerte opciones . 100% Recomendado.

Fresh and tasty food. Always enjoy their menu items whether is soup, salad or entree.  Have not had 1 bad experience and their staff is very friendly and provide great customer support.

Also tried their delivery service via uber eats and food always comes quick and warm, plus they sent me a free treat :). Thank you!

Amazing food and fresh made warm Colombia bread at your disposal! This place brings a Hispanic Starbucks environment. Come and drink amazing Colombian coffee with warm Colombian bread or if you‚Äôre hungry, enjoy a bandeja paisa plate with a passion fruit smoothie!

El dia de hoy fui pedi un iced latte la chica me puso iced coffe con muchisisisima leche literal un vaso de leche no dije nada y pedi un iced latte nuevamente y me dijo si kieres te puedo poner un shot de espreso y le dije ok üëç
La verdad la chica fue muy amable solo que como decirle sin hacerla sentir mal que un iced latte es un vaso literal de leche con shots de espresso!!!

Como critica constructiva due√±os capaciten a sus empleados para no tener que pasar por este mal momento de que las chicas en realidad no sepan hacer cafes termine pagando dos que bote a la basura porque era leche y no dije nada repito por no hacer sentir mal ala muchacha que me los estaba haciendo ü§∑
Beautiful place, amazing food and great service,I‚Äôm so happy to know this place. I absolutely recommend this restaurant, and beens bowl is my favorite

Una muy linda cafeter√≠a para ir a desayunar o merendar. Tiene comida muy rica y los precios son muy accesibles. Las chicas que atienden hablan en espa√±ol lo cual es una ventaja para los que no manejan tan bien el ingl√©s. El barrio donde est√° es muy lindo y pintoresco, de f√°cil acceso.
Girls there are so sweet and food is really yummy! I love the levanta muertos soup and the ham and cheeses croissant ü´∂üèΩ

My dad introduced me to this place. The food is amazing. Yes a little pricey. But overall the food is fresh and very tasty. We come almost every week to also get there pastries and they‚Äôre all amazing. The staff and girls are very nice and always attentive.

Nice and cute Colombian eatery but that‚Äôs about it.

The food was nothing special for the price. There are LOADS of other Colombian restaurants and bakeries in the nearby neighborhoods that serve the same food for half the price. I cannot believe I paid $28 for a breakfast plate with a very small arepa and some pieces of meat and barely any eggs, rice and beans. It‚Äôs just not worth that price at all. Go to any Colombian restaurant and you will easily get an entire bandeja paisa (typical lunch dish with all of this and more) for around this price. That‚Äôs a full lunch meal that can feed one person and have leftovers.

I‚Äôm sorry but the absurd prices just won‚Äôt convince me to come back here. On top of the fact that the service was very very slow and it wasn‚Äôt very busy.

Most places that advertise a cash discount usually show the card price on the receipt. Apparently not here. They ADDED a percentage once we paid with card. Not transparent.

I can‚Äôt justify spending $100+ for 3 people for breakfast. This is not it. Go to any other Colombian place in queens and save yourself serious money.
Comida colombiana y centro americana. El caf√© riqu√≠simo y platos regionales excelentes.
